page.title: 03LOCATION OF WESTBURY
page.content:
Overlooking the Somerset border,just three miles away,Westbury stands on the slopes of one of the most westerly promontories of the chalk downs of Salisbury Plain. The name Westbury was given by the early Saxons in the Dark Ages and it means"the fortified place in the West".In 1576 it appears as"Westburye-under-ye-Plane",to distinguish it from half-a-dozen other towns and villages of the same name. Today Westbury is a growing town of more than 7,000 people, proud of its ancient history as a market town, a gloving town, a woollen town and a railway town. The station today still provides a good, fast service to London, Bath, Bristol, Salisbury, Weymouth, Southampton and Portsmouth.
.
